snippet: The former Federal Reserve chairman says he may have purposely misled the public about one of the most crucial moments in recent financial history.
abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin DealBook column says former Federal Reserve chairman Ben S Bernanke, in his new book The Courage to Act: A Memoir of a Crisis and its Aftermath, wonders whether he should have 'been more forthcoming' over explanation of Lehman Brothers' bankruptcy; notes Bernanke's revelation that he and former Treasury Sec Henry M Paulson purposely concealed their inability to save firm.
lead_paragraph: The former Federal Reserve chairman says he may have purposely misled the public about one of the most crucial moments in recent financial history.

headline.print_headline: In Bernanke’s Memoir, a Candid Look at Lehman
headline.main: In Ben Bernanke’s Memoir, a Candid Look at Lehman Brothers’ Collapse
